properties.name: Gnowangerup
properties.description:
Services available:
Supermarket
Hotel - restaurant & accommodation
Caravan Park
Cafes
Service Station
Museum
Pool
Start your journey at the home of Wild
Gravel! Stock up on supplies, food and
sleep(!) before you set off. Celebrate at the
Hotel when you finish!

properties.name: Gnowangerup – Ongerup
properties.description: A beautifully quiet trek out along Old Ongerup Road that offers a lovely silhouette of the Stirlings, on your way to a satisfying food and drink stop at one of the numerous options around Ongerup.
properties.route notes:
At the 8.5km mark, if you continue approximately 2km straight ahead towards Formby Rd South, you can see the Horsepower Highway’s Phillipines Red Trucks.
At approximately 34km, the route follows Albany-Lake Grace Rd for around 3.5km. This section is sealed, fast, and often has truck traffic. Exercise caution on this section.
properties.accomodation and supplies:
Ongerup Hotel: 9828 2749
Ongerup Farm Supplies & General Store: 9828 2288
Yongergnow Malleefowl Centre and Cafe: 9828 2325
Ongerup Lunch Bar: 9828 2747
Ongerup Caravan Park: Phone Lex 0458 524 342

properties.name: Ongerup – Bluff Knoll
properties.description: A stunning southerly route that follows river beds, farm roads and rolling gravel hills. Offering increasingly stunning Stirling silhouettes as you approach Bluff Knoll. After rewarding yourself with a drink and meal at the Bluff Knoll Cafe, stay the night at Stirling Range Retreat or Mount Trio Bushcamp & Caravan Park. Visit Borden or Amelup for more food & drink options on your way.
properties.route notes: WARNING: The last 5km is on Chester Pass Road which is a Road Train route. Take extra care. We recommend moving off the road if a Road Train is approaching, particularly from behind.
properties.accomodation and supplies:
Bluff Knoll Cafe: https://the-bluff-knoll-cafe.edan.io/
Stirling Range Retreat: https://stirlingrange.com.au/
Mt Trio Bushcamp & Caravan Park: https://mttrio.com.au/
Borden Pub: https://www.facebook.com/thepubborden/
Amelup Service Station: 08 9827 9222
The Lily: https://www.thelily.com.au/

properties.name: Bluff Knoll – Mount Barker
properties.description: Undoubtedly the toughest, yet most spectacular section on the trail, including the legendary Stirling Range Drive. Enjoy a well deserved meal and drink in Mount Barker as you share your pictures and stories from this surely very memorable day.
properties.route notes:
WARNING: The first 8.5km is on Chester Pass Road which is a Road Train route. Take extra care. We recommend moving off the road if a Road Train is approaching, particularly from behind.
The last 12km into Mount Barker is sealed road with higher traffic speeds and volumes. Take care on this section, particularly as there may be truck traffic. 
This stage is the toughest section on the route, with limited water, and often no phone signal. Ensure you are well supplied before embarking.

properties.name: Mount Barker – Cranbrook (Via Kendenup)
properties.description: Set off from the southern most point on the route over beautiful rolling hills, grab refreshments in Kendenup, then enjoy the route flattening off and cruise into Cranbrook for a well earned meal.
properties.route notes: The first 7km out of Mount Barker is on sealed road with higher traffic speeds and volumes. Take care on this section, particularly as there may be truck traffic.

properties.name: Cranbrook – Katanning (Via Tambellup & Broomehill)
properties.description: Enjoy the stunning Stirlings silhouette to the east. Follow close to the old railway line for a gentle gradient and two town stops on your way to the largest town on the trail.
properties.route notes:
The first 5km north of Tambellup is on Great Southern highway, which carries a reasonably high volume of high speed general and truck traffic – caution should be exercised on this section.
The section between Clinic Rd north of Broomehill and McAuliffe Rd is also on the highway – as per the above.
properties.accomodation and supplies:
124 Tambellup Store (Open 7 Days): 9825 1104
Tambellup Hotel (Call to book): 9825 1010
Sage Cottage: AirBNB
Henry Jones Winery and Café
(Food and B&B accommodation in Broomehill – book ahead): 9824 1513 
Broomehill Caravan Park (Cabin accommodation, powered and unpowered caravan and camping sites, online bookings): 9825 3555

properties.name: Katanning – Gnowangerup
properties.description: The final stretch to finish the Wild Gravel Trail! Head out east of town and visit Lake Coyrecup before turning south towards your final stretch. Celebrate when you cross the finish line knowing you’ve done it, conquered the Wild Gravel Trail!
properties.route notes: There are no opportunities to replenish food or water between Katanning and Gnowangerup. Ensure you are well supplied before embarking.
